SEARCH
Package com.ubicua.didas.rest

Class CustomAdminComponentProvider

java.lang.Object
com.ubicua.didas.rest.CustomAdminComponentProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.keycloak.provider.Provider, org.keycloak.services.resources.admin.ext.AdminRealmResourceProvider
@Path("/admin") public class CustomAdminComponentProvider extends Object implements org.keycloak.services.resources.admin.ext.AdminRealmResourceProvider
REST resource provider for custom component updates in the Admin API.

Exposes a PUT endpoint at /admin/realms/{realm}/components/{id} to update component configurations, applying validation and permission checks using Keycloak's AdminAuth and AdminPermissions.

Author:
Ivan Kuchumov

  • Method Details

    • updateComponent

      @PUT @Path("/realms/{realm}/components/{id}") @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response updateComponent(@PathParam("realm") String realmName, @PathParam("id") String id, org.keycloak.representations.idm.ComponentRepresentation rep) throws org.keycloak.common.VerificationException
      Updates the configuration of an existing Realm component.

      This method performs the following steps:

      1. Realm Context Setup: resolves the target realm by name and sets it on the session context.
      2. Authentication: extracts and verifies the Bearer token, constructs an AdminAuth and AdminPermissionEvaluator to enforce realm management permissions.
      3. Component Lookup: loads the existing ComponentModel by its ID; returns 404 if missing.
      4. Field-by-Field Update: selectively updates name, parentId, providerType, providerId, subtype, and configuration entries. For each config key:
        • Skips unknown keys when internal is false.
        • Removes empty or masked values.
        • Strips whitespace from specific fields (e.g., "roles", "context").
      5. Persistence: applies realm.updateComponent(model) to save changes.
      Parameters:
      realmName - the name of the target realm
      id - the component ID to update
      rep - the new component representation from the request body
      Returns:
      HTTP 204 No Content on success, or an error response
      Throws:
      org.keycloak.common.VerificationException - if token verification fails

    • updateComponent

      private void updateComponent(org.keycloak.models.KeycloakSession session, org.keycloak.representations.idm.ComponentRepresentation rep, org.keycloak.component.ComponentModel component, boolean internal)
      Updates the configuration of an existing Realm component.

      This method performs the following steps:

      1. Realm Context Setup: resolves the target realm by name and sets it on the session context.
      2. Authentication: extracts and verifies the Bearer token, constructs an AdminAuth and AdminPermissionEvaluator to enforce realm management permissions.
      3. Component Lookup: loads the existing ComponentModel by its ID; returns 404 if missing.
      4. Field-by-Field Update: selectively updates name, parentId, providerType, providerId, subtype, and configuration entries. For each config key:
        • Skips unknown keys when internal is false.
        • Removes empty or masked values.
        • Strips whitespace from specific fields (e.g., "roles", "context").
      5. Persistence: applies realm.updateComponent(model) to save changes.
      Parameters:
      session - current Keycloak session
      rep - incoming ComponentRepresentation containing updates
      component - the persistent ComponentModel to modify
      internal - if true, bypasses config property filtering

    • localizedErrorResponse

      private jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response localizedErrorResponse(org.keycloak.component.ComponentValidationException cve)
      Constructs a Response with a localized error message when component validation fails.

      This method:

      • Extracts parameters from the ComponentValidationException.
      • Optionally localizes each parameter using AdminRoot messages.
      • Formats a custom error message (currently hard-coded) and returns ErrorResponse.error(..., BAD_REQUEST).
      Parameters:
      cve - the exception containing validation error details
      Returns:
      a ResponseException wrapping the localized error
